question: 全米
sourceMnemonic: Do you remember how <ja>米国</ja> can mean "America?" That <ja>米</ja> means America sometimes. So, when you see <kanji>all</kanji> <kanji>rice</kanji> (I mean, <kanji>America</kanji>), you can think of this word as meaning <vocabulary>All America</vocabulary> (sort of like how <ja>全日本</ja> means "All Japan.").
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
